title: Big Microsoft outage locks people out of Windows and Xbox accounts
text:
Microsoft Getty Microsoft appears to be in the throes of another service outage – with users locked out of services such as Windows, Skype and Xbox.
Woman's vagina left 'like it had grown teeth biting lover's penis' by op The Verge reports that multiple Microsoft services including Xbox Live, Outlook.com, Skype, OneDrive, and Microsoft’s Windows Store are affected.
Metro attempted to log in using Windows account details, and was unable to log in to the Microsoft Account page.
It’s the second time in a month that Microsoft services have gone down – after Hotmail users were left unable to log in on March 7.
I hope Microsoft issues a public statement on today's Microsoft Account outage. Second time in a month doesn't promote confidence
— Tom Warren (@tomwarren) March 21, 2017 
Looks like @Outlook servers are down. So is everything @Microsoft not working? #outage 
— Trung Nguyen (@Chilly613) March 21, 2017 
Xbox Live sign-in is down due to a massive Hotmail, Outlook outage. Time to split services Microsoft!? https://t.co/1LtteN51uo 
— Product Reviews (@productreviews) March 21, 2017 

On Microsoft’s Xbox service page, Microsoft says there is an issue with users not being able to buy or unlock games.
Microsoft says, ‘Our engineers and developers are actively continuing to work to resolve the issue causing some members to have problems finding previously-purchased content or purchasing new content. Stay tuned, and thanks for your patience.’
